review_title: Rewarding despite the challenges ; find your WHY
job_title: Senior Account Manager- Digital Sales in Prague
pros:
Full account management / full accountability / fast implementation of new strategy / management support / team target / Compensation plan/ autonomy (no micro- management

My why: After several years of pure Renewal account Management, it was time for me to see the wider picture. Having your own accounts that you fully manage (renew, up-sell/cross-sell) in both business units CA technologies and Symantec, you are in the driver's seat. Even helping the collection team when needed.
Explaining and implementing the strategy, re-establishing the trust in the customers and partners after Broadcom's acquisitions is a unique experience where your hard work, your personality and the things you do really count. 
Nothing comes easy but the reward is here: (over)achievement. Money wise, the compensation plan is here to support that culture of result and hard work. Important to be mentioned, it's a team target AND that works. On personal/professional level it teaches you to go beyond, to realize how resilient you are and to find your own balance. 
Your colleagues are hard-workers, dedicated and will want someone who is reliable
The Management Team believes in individual accountability and gives you autonomy to do your work and develop your list of accounts. There is no micro-management, that 's a big Plus. 

Broadcom is a solid company with a strong and clear strategy. In the same time it's an agile business, learning fast, implementing fast and correcting fast. You are in a flat organisation which gives you the possibility to try things, being involved in projects and build your own career/success.

Like any company, there are pro's and con's.
If you understand the business values, if you find WHY you are here and WHY you are doing it, you will feel fine in Broadcom.
cons:
Navigating to find the internal resources /Improving support quality/ To implement New hire training


In Sales, ideally you want dedicated resources to make your Renewals or your Sell cycle as smooth and easy as possible. 

In Broadcom, the same way you educate your customers and partners to be more autonomous, you will apply it to yourself ; it could be challenging to find/navigate through internal resources (especially as a New Hire) and you are in a self-serve mode in a way. After you overcome the frustration and put it into perspective (grass isn't that greener elsewhere), it teaches you to be autonomous, to think outside the box, find alternatives and be creative. 
Your colleagues are helpful and Management is supportive.
